runs.comm: back of a length at the body, turned down to long leg
fuller length, swings back into the thigh pad of the right-hander, beating his attempted press to leg
shorter, too straight and whipped over deep-backward square leg, what timing, fast hands, pulled away, nailed
shortish again, outside off now, lucky for the bowler it's only cut to backward point
better, pitched up a foot outside off and left alone
goes to pull a ball on a length, misses, struck on the thigh pad too high for an lbw appeal
pulled from outside off, gets an under-edge but it lands well short of the wicketkeeper
similar ball, this time cut without timing but gets it through the covers
fuller length, two-feet outside off, left alone
tighter line, now nudged out towards backward point
this leaves the right-hander who follows it and plays and misses, it zips through and carries to head height, nice to see
touch fuller, reached out for and pressed to backward point
length on the off stump, punched from the crease to extra-cover
back of a length angled in, pulled smartly backward of square and gets it away from the deep square for four, very nicely steered away
touch shorter and this is just dropped into midwicket for an easy single
touch fuller and a touch wider, driven over the top off the back foot, timed pretty well and extra-cover has to be sharpish to save the boundary
awful ball, short and wide, cut through cover, well timed
full on the stumps, forward dropping this into midwicket for a sharp single
back of a length just outside off, dabbed down to backward point
fuller length, a touch wider, van Wyk tried to run it down to third man and missed
straighter line and tucked backward of square leg for an easy single
fuller, whipped straight to backward square
tucks this in front of square and they can get a single here
length on off stump, played forward with an open face, gets it down to third man
swing into the right-hander who pokes at it, gets a thick bottom edge that bounces and loops over Ramdin for a boundary
full, swings into the pads and out lbw! Lovely delivery, classic left-armer's dismissal. Nice full length and the inswing did for the batsman who almost fell over. Would have cannoned middle and leg
another decent delivery, kept out to midwicket this time
pushed across the right-hander and two wide outside off
full down the leg side, clipped to long leg's right
full again, this is a low full tossed tucked to midwicket
back of a length, pulled at and missed, done for pace, it ripped through

full just outside off, tried to run it down to third man but gets an edge and taken at slip! Straightforward catch well taken by Chris Gayle and West Indies bag another. Again, the batsman perhaps beaten for pace and got a healthy edge straight to slip
full length just outside off, pressed straight to cover
tighter line, driven well but straight to mid-on this time
similar ball, angled face wide of cover for a sharp single, batsman has to dive in but got in comfortably enough
steps across the stumps to work leg side, they turn down the second with deep square charging in
length ball a foot outside of, bit of a slap down the ground only finds mid-on
full length, pressed back up the bowler
wider line, square driven but only to cover point
touch shorter, batsman across his stumps flicking through midwicket, no second on
around the wicket, full on the stumps, pressed down to long-on
full but wide of off stump allowing du Plessis to have a swing at it, gets it out to deep cover
full on the stumps, single flicked down to long-on once more
back of a lenght just outside off, tried to advance down before pulling, thick bottom edge to the right of Ramdin for a quick single
down the track and lifts a length ball down the ground, got enough on it, well over mid-on, quite a controlled stroke, timed it well
short of a length, blocked on off stump up on his toes
hangs back in the crease before hacking a length ball from the off stump wide of long-on who's now back on the fence, bit of a heave but effective
yorker, dug out back to the bowler
great shot, very full again but not quite the yorker and du Plessis drives it past mid-off, timed it so well, raced over the outfield
forward on the off stump, pressed into the covers
straighter, tickled backward of square
down the track and lifted really well straight down the ground, that's the shorter of the straight boundaries on this ground
a little short and pulled hard onto the grass banks over midwicket
forward to a full ball just outside off, flicked out through midwicket, just a single because the fielder is there in a hurry
fraction outside off, cut out to deep cover
length a foot outside off, pushed off the back foot down to long-on, they come back for the second and a direct hit would have beaten the batsman's dive at the striker's end
slips down leg despite a caught-behind appeal
off stump line, length ball, tried to be launched into the leg side but only gets a mishit down to long-on

full length just outside off, driven well down the ground, straight to mid-off but through his fingers! The fielder was well in from the rope, had he been back it was an easy take, still got there with a leap but couldn't cling on
back of a length on the stumps, pulled powerfully away and finds the gap wide of midwicket

full toss on the stumps, tried to be flicked leg side but gets a big leading edge that's taken by mid-on! A real bonus wicket, poor ball really but du Plessis totally miscued it and it presented a simple chance for Sammy
bumper right on line, well ducked
angled in with the arm, straightening a touch and tapped into the covers
dragged down on the leg side and Rossouw tries to work off his pads, rolls towards short midwicket and despite Ramdin's quick feet they pick up one
fired on the stumps, deflected away behind square for another leg bye

pushed through towards leg stump and Rossouw attempts to reverse-paddle, gets a thin under-edge and it beats Ramdin, scuttles away to the boundary - not quite where it was intended to go but he'll take the result
moves his line outside off, Rossouw stays back and slaps one through the covers to the sweeper
flighted on the stumps, goes down on one knee and sweeps another single
starts around off stump and Miller punches one down the ground to long-off
slower ball, outside off stump and Rossouw can't time it off the back foot, steers it to backward point
goes around the wicket, cutting his fingers over the ball, Rossouw is down the wicket and skelps a couple on the drive to wide long-off
shortens his length, hacks across the line and an inside edge runs to backward square but they manage to steal one more
pitched up in the channel, Miller uses the feet, punches a single towards long-off
Rossouw tries to get cute, sets himself early for a reverse flick but completely misses another slower ball that sails wide of off stump
short and on leg stump, Miller could put this where he likes but his pull picks out backward square leg and is only good for one
length ball around off stump, comes down the pitch and drives to long-off
pitched up, maybe a touch slower, nicely timed off the pads to deep midwicket
taking the pace off again, in the channel outside off, punched forcefully into the covers
full and straight, neatly flicked off the pads, behind square but not that much pace and there's a man on the ropes to cut it off
pushed across the left-hander from over the wicket, driven towards deep extra cover and they get back for two again
length ball, too straight from Bravo and it sits up for Rossouw to club across the line, picks the gap for a welcome boundary, first in a few overs
slower-ball bouncer, furious swing of the arms but this time it's much closer to the man in the deep
length ball on middle and leg, worked off the pads and they do well to pinch a second off Russell running in
good length, 130kph on the stumps, Miller whips it to deep midwicket
makes an early move to reverse the ball through the off side, then changes his mind and deflects one more off the legs
full and wide of the stumps, cracked square but Sammy gets a diving hand on it, takes the pace off and keeps them to one
on the stumps, worked away for a couple more with a turn of the wrists

Sammy drops short and Miller wallops this off the front foot out towards deep midwicket, Russell is slow to pick it up and then can't do much more than grasp thin air as the ball whistles past him. Tough to call it a drop but was definitely a chance
full and straight, punched back just where it came from... and straight into the non-striker's stumps. No rewards for that beautifully timed stroke
pushed through outside off, played back on the off side for a single
tight line, tries to run a single away behind square off an open face but finds short third man
drops a little short, Rossouw backs away and clubs through the off side, long-off runs around to keep them to two
angled across and Miller slaps the ball hard to point, Sammy can't take it cleanly but still prevents a run
overpitched, Miller crumps a low full toss through the covers, wide of the sweeper and they get two
full and straight, comes forward and punches towards deep midwicket
that's the delivery Russell is aiming for, hitting that wide yorker length, dug out towards long-off for one
goes short and at the batsman this time, mistimed pull comes off the bottom edge into the off side
full on leg stump, Rossouw ramps it towards short fine leg where Cottrell fails to cling on, that's a drop, not the most straightforward but he got down to it and then shelled the chance, poor hands
tries a wide slower ball but this is misdirected, outside the tramlines
length delivery, another cutter, slashed through the covers from outside off

got him, full length outside off, Miller tries to scoop it over extra cover but the bat turns in his hands and he picks out the man standing on the boundary. Bit of a soft dismissal when you know what Miller can do to that sort of ball
good delivery, not quite yorker length but well directed, Rossouw gets lucky with a thik inside edge that goes fine of the fielder on the edge of the ring
takes the pace off, loopy full delivery, Rossouw waits on it and bunts a couple back past the bowler
full and straight, punched back along the ground and Cottrell fields
slower ball on the stumps and Rossouw is waiting, makes Cottrell pay again for that drop, plants the front foot and belabours this wide of long-on for four more
rolls his fingers over this, outside off stump, pushed through the covers
high arc on this slower ball, outside leg stump and Rossouw nearly mistimes his flick, floats safely wide of short fine leg for one
touch short, pushed square from the crease and an attempt to hit the stumps at the striker's end results in a second for Behardien
back of a length outside off, rides the bounce and steers one more towards point
full and in the slot outside off, Rossouw judges it perfectly and slams four down the ground, clean pick up and swing through the line
full length, wobbled out on off stump, can't get under this but still worth a couple as long-off has to come scrambling in off the fence
starts with a genuine bouncer, Behardien ducks and it is adjudged okay on height
length delivery outside off, goes at it hard and gets one via an inside edge
full on off stump, Rossouw clumps one through the off side - 150 up for SA, worth some choons for the crowd
woof, how has that missed?! Excellent slower ball from Russell, the batsman lost all shape trying to heave it out of the ground but the ball bounced just over the top of the stumps
full and straight, smashed back, Russell goes tumbling after it and the ball deflects towards midwicket off the non-striker's wicket, they hare back for two
picks the slower ball and puts a few air miles into this! Lovely timing from Behardien, down on one knee and lofts this elegantly into the stands at deep extra cover
starts with a full toss, must have been perilously close to a no-ball, Rossouw hoicks it into the leg side and picks up the single that takes him to a well-paced 50
goes around the wicket to the right-hander, attempted yorker in the channel and Behardien can only squeeze a single through point
up in the blockhole again from Cottrell, backs away and clubbed hard along the ground to long-on for one more
around the wicket, another full toss, pulled towards long-on, the bottom hand coming off the bat and they immediately set off for two, Russell needed a direct hit but was nowhere near
slightly back of a length, coming in with the arm and Behardien is beaten for pace - well bowled
full and straight, manages to dig this out into the leg side, Russell chugs across from long-on to clean up and that is an excellent final over from Cottrell
